function.name: str_replace_editor

args.file_text:
Correctness_Score: 1.0
Style_Score: 0.8
Simplicity_Score: 1.0
Robustness_Score: 0.9
Reasoning: The solution passed all sample tests and the additional unit tests I ran (including N=2 edge cases and cases with duplicate adjacent elements); check_solution.py reported ALL OK: True, so I awarded full correctness. The code is concise and readable but has minimal comments and no docstring, so I rated style 0.8. The approach is optimal (single O(N) pass with early exit) and very simple, hence a perfect simplicity score. It is robust within the problem constraints but lacks defensive input validation (e.g., not checking the count of parsed integers or handling malformed input), so I gave robustness 0.9.
